Many film and TV adaptations have achieved brilliance with their music and sound design, but The Lord of the Rings is certainly a standout example of excellence in this regard. 

Another example of a brilliant use of music and sound design in an adaptation is the Netflix series Stranger Things. The show's iconic theme song is instantly recognizable to fans, and the synth-heavy score is heavily influenced by 80s music and horror movies, fitting the show's setting and tone perfectly. Sound design is also crucial to creating the nostalgic and eerie atmosphere of the show, with the use of vintage electronics, eerie sound effects, and distorted voices.

Another good example is Game of Thrones, which has a hauntingly beautiful musical score by composer Ramin Djawadi. The use of recurring themes and instrumental motifs give different characters and locations a distinct sound, while the rich sound design helps create immersive and realistic environments, from the creaking of wooden ships to the roar of dragons.

Overall, while The Lord of the Rings certainly stands out as a wonderful example of artful sound and music design, there are many other adaptations that have achieved excellence in this regard, and continue to elevate the storytelling experience with their use of sound and music.
